newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: ABS revises Australia goods/services balance data.
newsitem.headline: ABS revises Australia goods/services balance data.

text.p: The Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS) said on Tuesday the surplus on the balance of goods and services in 1996/97 had been revised down by A$837 million.
The deficit in 1995/96 had increased by A$208 million, while the deficit for 1994/95 had been reduced by A$139 million, 1993/94 by A$141 million, and 1992/93 by A$217 million.

The bureau said the main factors contributing to revisions in original terms were more recent information on spending by foreign tourists, which would be detailed in publicly released data next month.

Downward revisions in gold exports of A$80 million in 1995/96 and A$256 million in the 11 months to May, 1997, coupled with an upward revision of A$178 million for gold imports in the 11 month period also affected the figures.
The bureau said there had also been a change in the seasonal analysis of imports, due to changing import patterns because of tariff reductions, which usually applied from each July.
However, the current programme of reductions ended in July, 1996.
